| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | [dNetHack monst.c, line 5406](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.1/src/monst.c#L5406) |

A **peasant** is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

  - [1.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [1.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack_2)

- [3 References](#References)

## Generation

Peasants are not randomly generated in either variant.

### dNetHack

Peasants appear as the [quest guardians](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian") of the [Binder quest](/wiki/Binder_quest_\(dNetHack\) "Binder quest (dNetHack)") - unusually, they are found within the locate level, rather than on the home level with the [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"). Various peaceful and hostile peasants also appear on many levels of the default [Noble quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest").

Peasants are generated [armed with one of the following items](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory"): a [sickle](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Items#Sickle "User:Chris/dNetHack/Items"), [scythe](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Items#Scythe "User:Chris/dNetHack/Items"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), or [voulge](/wiki/Voulge "Voulge") (which are all weapons derived from farming implements).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### SlashTHEM

In addition to appearing on the default Noble quest, the [Town](/wiki/Town "Town") has five peaceful peasants that appear in the village at the top floor.

## Strategy

### dNetHack

Peasants are relatively slow and weak - the rebellious ones in the Noble quest pose little threat to the player, except possibly in combination with each other and with the other hostile @ that appear on the quest. The weapons they drop will be of little use to a well-equipped [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [dNetHack makemon.c, line 2607](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.1/src/makemon.c#L2607)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Peasant

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ peasant
Difficulty 3
Attacks Weapon 1d1 physical
@ peasant
Difficulty 3
Attacks

Weapon 1d1 physical

Base level 1
Base experience 13
Speed 10
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment 1 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium
Resistances none
Resistances conveyed none

A peasant:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference dNetHack monst.c, line 5406

A peasant is a monster that appears in dNetHack and SlashTHEM.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
    • 1.1 dNetHack
    • 1.2 SlashTHEM
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 dNetHack
  • 3 References

Generation

Peasants are not randomly generated in either variant.

dNetHack

Peasants appear as the quest guardians of the Binder quest - unusually, they are found within the locate level, rather than on the home level with the quest leader. Various peaceful and hostile peasants also appear on many levels of the default Noble quest.

Peasants are generated armed with one of the following items: a sickle, scythe, knife, club, axe, or voulge (which are all weapons derived from farming implements).[1]

SlashTHEM

In addition to appearing on the default Noble quest, the Town has five peaceful peasants that appear in the village at the top floor.

Strategy

dNetHack

Peasants are relatively slow and weak - the rebellious ones in the Noble quest pose little threat to the player, except possibly in combination with each other and with the other hostile @ that appear on the quest. The weapons they drop will be of little use to a well-equipped Noble.

References

  1. ↑ dNetHack makemon.c, line 2607

A '''peasant''' is a [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[SlashTHEM]].

==Generation==
Peasants are not randomly generated in either variant.

===dNetHack===
Peasants appear as the [[quest guardian]]s of the [[Binder quest (dNetHack)|Binder quest]] - unusually, they are found within the locate level, rather than on the home level with the [[quest leader]]. Various peaceful and hostile peasants also appear on many levels of the default [[Noble quest]].

Peasants are generated [[Monster starting inventory|armed with one of the following items]]: a [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Items#Sickle|sickle]], [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Items#Scythe|scythe]], [[knife]], [[club]], [[axe]], or [[voulge]] (which are all weapons derived from farming implements).<ref>[https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.1/src/makemon.c#L2607 dNetHack makemon.c, line 2607]</ref>

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to appearing on the default Noble quest, the [[Town]] has five peaceful peasants that appear in the village at the top floor.

==Strategy==
===dNetHack===
Peasants are relatively slow and weak - the rebellious ones in the Noble quest pose little threat to the player, except possibly in combination with each other and with the other hostile {{white|@}} that appear on the quest. The weapons they drop will be of little use to a well-equipped [[Noble]].
